title: Sri Lanka schedules 3 hours 20 min power cuts on April 21 -22
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of 3 hours and 20 minutes have been approved for Sri Lanka on Thursday (21) and Friday (22), 2022, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as forex shortages due to money printing by the central bank triggered forex shortages disrupting fuel imports.
All Areas (ABCDEFGHIJKLPQRSTUVW) will have power cuts of 2 hours from 0900am to 0500pm and 1 hour and 20 minutes from 0500pm and 0900pm.
Download the full power cut schedule from here: Demand Managmet Schedule-21-22nd April 2022

Though rains have started to come, Sri Lanka is still facing severe forex shortages from a flexible exchange rate (intermediate regime soft-peg). An attempt to float the currency (suspend convertibility) has not succeeded amid a surrender requirement. (Colombo/ April 20/2022)
